summary:
Geoscientist at Shell, currently deployed as a Production Geoscientist in West Africa assets. 
Background: PhD in Durham University, Department of Earth Sciences, focusing on the structural evolution of continental transform margins and their response to plate motion changes. 
Specialisation in structural geology, seismic interpretation and transform systems.

projects:
[{'title': 'BSc Thesis, Seismic Risk Assessment in the Attiki Basin, Greece.', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Developed a high resolution Seismic Risk map for the most populated area of Greece. 
Geological, geomorphological, land use and demographic data regarding the basin were gathered and inserted in an ArcGIS environment as data layers.
The layers were then overlayed and the final Seismic Risk product was calculated using different types of algorithms to produce the most accurate result.
The process was then verified by comparing the produced map to the damage assessment done for the 1999 Athens earthquake. 
(currently prepared for publication)', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Pavlos', 'last_name': 'Farangitakis', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Geoscientist at Shell'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Orestis', 'last_name': 'Brentas', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Precious Metals Trader'}]}, {'title': 'MSc Thesis, Prospectivity of the Judd Basin, West of Shetland.', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Identified the key components that lead to a successful petroleum play in the Judd Basin using literature, well and seismic data.
